name: 莊清松
objective:
— To introduce the fundamental architectures, characteristics and applications of modern wireless radio frequency and microwave systems from a system approach point of view.

— To introduce the fundamental characteristics of radio wave radiation and propagation.

— To introduce the analysis of mobile microwave wireless system performance based on system architecture, modulation techniques and radio propagation effect.

— To introduce the analysis and design of critical components at the RF front-end of wireless radio communication systems.

Week 3: Introduction of Modern Digital Modulation in Modern Wireless Radio Link Systems-
Week 4: Radio Frequency Linkage in Physical Effects

Week 7: Noise and Multipath Effect in Wireless Radio Receiver
Week 8: Distortion in Wireless Radio Receiver
Week 9: Middle Term Course Review Examination
Week 10: Introduction of Electromagnetic Wave Radiation for Wireless Communications 
Week 11: Electrical Current Excited Small Antenna Design for Wireless Radio Link Systems
Week 12: Electrical Current Excited Resonate Antennas for Wireless Radio Link Systems
Week 13: Impedance Broadband Wire Antennas for Wireless Radio Link Systems
Week 14: Magnetic Current Excited Resonate Patch Antennas for Wireless Radio Link Systems
Week 15: Introduction to Matching Techniques for Wireless Radio Link Systems
Week 16: Radio Frequency Coupler and Power Divider for Wireless Radio Link Systems

Week 18: Issues on Updated Techniques for Next Generation Wireless Radio Link Systems
